text:
Hey guys this week we're in Stellenbosch,
South Africa!

Yes, so we're in the heart of the Cape Winelands
and that can only mean one thing.

We're going to be drinking lots and lots of
wine.
Let's get started.

On our very first trip to South Africa we
spent one day in Stellenbosch where we did
a wine tour and hit up a total of 5 wineries.

It was an action packed day but we knew we
had only seen a fraction of what this place
has to offer and we were itching to return!

Fast forward two years, and we found ourselves
with an invitation to come and experience
Stellenbosch, this time with a week to spare.
Naturally we said yes!

This being the winelands meant that our itinerary
was wine heavy, but we also got to sample

the food, visit the markets, check out the
nightlife and get close to nature.

The following is our travel guide to Stellenbosch,
pour yourself a glass of wine, sit back, and
join us on this ride!

We kicked off our first evening in Stellenbosch
with a dinner at Delheim.

The sun had already gone down so we didn’t
get to tour the vineyard, but we did get to

sample their wines together with a delicious
Cape Malay dinner.

However, the cherry on top was the cupcake
and wine pairing we did for dessert.

Delheim, is the only winery to offer this
pairing, and it was an unexpected treat - a
must for anyone with a sweet tooth!

Speaking of having a sweet tooth, another
wine tasting we really enjoyed was at Avontuur,
where they paired wine with fudge!

Alright, this morning we're at Avontuur Estate
and we're going to be doing a self-guided

walking tour of the vineyards and then we're
going to go back and have some wine.

Our tour of the vineyard mostly consisted
of us trying to befriend their beautiful horses,
and then it was time to drink some wine!

So right now we're going to do a wine and
fudge pairing.
This is going to be delicious.
I can already tell.
And the portions of fudge are beyond generous.
Check this out.

So here we have dark chocolate fudge, mint
chocolate fudge, cocoa and caramel fudge,

fig and walnut nougat and cranberry and macadamia
nougat.
So many choices and so much wine.

The saddest part of the day was when the tasting
ended and I accidentally left behind my whole
box of fudge.
A true tragedy for this foodie over here!

So poor Sam over here has been having such
a good time that he lost his voice.
I lost my voice.
Womp womp.

Seriously, this is me speaking as loud as
I can.

Alright, so using hand gestures can you tell
us how was the wine and fudge combo?
Haha.
Excellent.
Double thumbs up.

Later that afternoon we went to the Blaauwklippen
Family Market which takes place on Sundays
at the Blaauwklippen Vineyards.

This is a family favourite that features games,
rides, antique and souvenir stands, but we
were here for the food.

Audrey decided to stop at Mr. Spitbraai and
she was surprised with one of the largest
plates of lamb she’s ever had.
It is nice and tender.
It won't get better than that.
And it has got a little bit of fat on it also.

So for lunch today we're at the Blaauwlklippen
Market and we just ordered ourselves some
lamb neck and the portion is massive.

Like this is enough to feed a whole family
and it comes with a side of potatoes.

It looks delicious and I'm going to show you
that now.
Alright, so I'm going to try this.
Let's just dig right in.

It looks like we have a lot of meat and some
fat as well.
Making it nice and juicy.
Oh, look at that.
Mmmm.
That is really good.

It is like salty and crispy on the exterior
and then just super juicy and tender.

Like this has been cooking for a while in
its own fat.
It is so good.
Wow.
Let's grab some potato too.
Mmmm.
And this is what Sam is having.

He still does not have his voice back but
look at that Schnitzel in a bun.
Massive.
Let's see.
Mmmm.
That is the look of a happy boy.

That evening we visited Middlevlei Wine Estate,
which is a vineyard that we had been to before
on our first visit to Stellenbosch.

This time around we had a delicious braai
(which is Afrikaans for BBQ), but not before

taking part in a team wine-blending competition
to try and create the best blend.
Well good evening.

I don't know if you can hear in the background
but things are getting pretty rowdy.

This evening we're at Middlevlei and we are
having a wine blending session.

We are playing around with Pinotage, Shiraz
and Merlot and we're going to see what we
can create together.
Hopefully my team wins.
So let's head back to the table.
So this is our blend.

We are calling it the Blind Blender because
our teammate created the wine but he didn't
even taste it.
So this is just pure science.

25% Shiraz, 75% Merlot and a little bit of
sugar.
Haha!
I said I was going to laugh.
This is team C. Haha!
The Blind Blender.
That is us.

And all this commotion because the Blind Blender
won.
Of course he hasn't actually tasted the wine.
And this dog found the best spot for a nap.
Hello pup.

Waking up the following morning may have been
a bit of a struggle for our group, but we

had a fun activity waiting for us: a segway
tour through the vineyard!

We've been staying at Spier for the past few
days and that is a really large vineyard and

there is a lot of ground to cover so today
we are going to be riding Segways around the
property.

Yeah, and it is our first time ever to try
this.
Mmmhmm.
So it should be adventurous.

We all looked a bit shaky and apprehensive
when we were first getting on the segways,

but 5 minutes into we were all acting like
cowboys on wheels!
Our first stop.
Our first impressions.
I survived.

I was a little bit wobbly starting out but
you know you get the hang of it after a while.

We're only going 10 kilometers an hour so
it is not so bad.

And yeah, we're at our first stop and I've
had a fly land on the glasses.

Spier is one of South Africa’s oldest wine
farms and it’s still family run, so it was

cool hearing a bit of the history, while cruising
on these futuristic contraptions.

I can say with certainty that we all got hooked
on segway riding that day.
Well, well we are back where it all began.
How was it?
Well, let's start off.
We survived it.
Yes.
It is all about balance.

Lean forward to go forward, stand up straight
to stop, lean backwards to go backwards.
So once you get your balance then you're set.

And then you kind of keep a loose grip on
the handle and you know what?
None of us wiped out.
So voila!
Voila.

Lunch that day was at the Hoghouse BBQ and
Bakery which is located on the Spier Wine
Farm.

We started out with craft ales followed by
meat platters with beef brisket, spare ribs,

lamb shoulder, pork belly and an assortment
of other cuts.

This was paired with a mix of sides and salads
that left us feeling stuffed beyond belief,

but then dessert came around and we somehow
found a way to tuck into the pastries.

In between all the feasting and vineyard hopping,
we also found a bit of time to explore Stellenbosch
itself.

Stellenbosch is a charming town located in
the Western Cape, and it’s the second oldest

European settlement in the province after
Cape Town.

The streets are lined with oak trees, the
buildings are all painted white, and you have

a cool mix of Early Cape, Cape Dutch, and
Victorian architecture.

Another fun activity we took part in was a
wine safari, where we toured Jordan Wines
in an open safari-style Land Rover.
The views were pretty spectacular!

So this morning we are going on a wine safari
and when I first heard the words wine safari
I was like oh wow.

They are letting us go animal watching and
we're going to be drinking wine at the same
time.
This could be a dangerous combination.

But no, a wine safari is just basically a
drive through the vineyards.

So we're going to be making stops along the
way and looking at the vines and drinking

some wine so no animals on the itinerary but
plenty of wine and it should be lots
of fun.

Our wine safari was followed by an al fresco
lunch at the same vineyard.

Here we enjoyed a spread of breads, dips,
cheeses, olives and deli meats.
With you guessed it more wine.

That afternoon we travelled to Kayamandi,
which translates to “sweet or pleasant home”
in Xhosa.

Kayamandi is a township in the suburbs of
Stellenbosch and we visited with local guide

Thembi as part of the Stellenbosch 360 initiative,
which aims to show visitors a 360 degree view
of Stellenbosch beyond wine tourism.
Thembi was the perfect person to show us around.

For starters she had us laughing at her jokes
the whole afternoon.

Because she’s a Kayamandi local, she was
able to share an insider’s perspective of
township life.

So we just finished touring Kayamandi, which
is one of the townships here in Stellenbosch,

and we went around with a local guide whose
family has been here for 3 generations.

And now we are doing a dine with a local experience
so we've been invited into someone's home
and we're going to go have dinner.

It is already set up on the table and it looks
so good.

For dinner we had chakalaka, a spicy vegetable
relish dish; pab, which is made from ground

maize and reminded us of polenta; and a few
other tasty pumpkin and spinach dishes.
(Traditional Music)

After that action packed day we returned back
to town for some music and drinks at Rebellion
Courtyard Cafe.
(Singing along to live music)
Dadada duh dah.
You guys at the back.

Well after days of feasting on braai and drinking
copious amounts of wine I have to say I'm
really glad we're going for a hike this morning.

This morning we're visiting Jonkershoek Park
and yeah we're just going to be going for
a walk out in the forest.
So this is a very welcome trip.

Jonkershoek Nature Reserve is located just
under 10 kilometres from Stellenbosch, so

it’s a very easy outing if you’re looking
for a taste of nature.

The Jonkershoek mountains are home to Leopards,
Caracals, Honey Badgers and Baboons, but it’s

probably a good thing we didn’t encounter
them up close.
So the hike so far has been going great.
I mean nice weather, really awesome scenery.

Like I'm enjoying all of these mountain views
and then kind of popping in and out of the
forest.
There is some barren landscapes as well.

And now apparently I think we're going to
go visit a lake so let's go check that out.

And while Sam was off hiking, I did a biking
tour of Stellenbosch with the Adventure Shop,

where I learned a bit more about the town’s
history.

The tour ended at Lanzerac Wine Estate where
we met the group once again.

Here we had a light lunch featuring a spread
of cheeses, deli meats, fresh fruits, and
wine!

We were all pretty famished after a morning
of exercise so we devoured everything on the
table.

That afternoon we went on a vinegar tasting,
because it turns out there’s more to Stellenbosch
than wine!

We visited Rozendal Farm which has a unique
history.

They used to be a winery but then one year
the owner Kurt Amman discovered that his 1988

vintage was flawed - it contained way too
much acidity!

Rather than throwing out the wine, he decided
to experiment with vinegar making and a new
business was born.

So this afternoon we are at Rozendal and we're
going to be doing a vinegar tasting.

I've only done this once before so we're going
to get a quick tour of the place and then
let the tasting begin.
It is time for the vinegar tasting to begin.

This is exciting because that last time we
tried this I think we were in Italy.
Yeah, in Moldina.
Yeah, that is right.

And I can't say I'm a huge vinegar fan by
itself but with a good vinegar like a balsamic

vinegar or something like that it tastes really
nice.
And this is fancy vinegar.
This isn't what you'd find in the supermarket.
What do you think?
Wow.
That is really nice.

It is sour but it also is balanced out by
a richness and a sweetness.
Yeah.
And so it is very palateable.

It goes down smoothly and I absolutely love
it.

I could drink this straight from the bottle
to be honest.
Forget the salad.
Yeah.
Have you made a new friend Audrey?
We have made a new friend.
I believe this is Jasper.
Jasper.
Based on the name tag.
You are a beautiful boy Jasper.
Hi!
You are a beautiful boy.
Second friend.
Second friend.
Second friend of the day.
Hi pup.
Aww.
Hallo.
I'm napping in the sun.

And then there was more wine, this time at
the Delaire Graff Estate.

This is one of the most luxurious wineries
we visited during our week in Stellenbosch

and it is quite unique in the sense that it
combined wine with art.

They have beautiful works by some of South
Africa’s leading artists, and our meals
were culinary works of art themselves.

It may only be eleven in the morning but I'm
at Van Ryn's right now and it is time for
a brandy tasting and tour.
Liver I hope you've woken up.

Van Ryn’s is the only brandy distillery
in Stellenbosch and it is considered to be
a world class brandy.

They’ve won the title of Worldwide Best
Brandy five times, and the International Spirits
Competition trophy for Best Brandy three times.

So we've done the tour so now it is time for
the tasting and the coolest thing I learned

today is that you absolutely should not be
swirling the brandy.
You warm it up with the bottom of your hand.
I guess it was like what 20 to 30 seconds?
Is that right?
Yeah, about 10 to 15 seconds.

So I've actually been holding mine for a long
time.
So time to taste it.
Oh, that is really good.

It goes down really smooth so that is how
I know it is a really good quality brandy.

We have just arrived at Tokara and this is
another vineyard.

They obviously produce wine because this is
Stellenbosch but they also have a beautiful

olive grove so we're going to be doing an
olive oil tasting while we are here.

Here we sampled 5 different types of extra
virgin olive oil and then we walked over to

their deli where we had a really nice brunch
overlooking the vineyard.
Cake for breakfast totally happened!
So we've experienced the wines here in Stellenbosch.

Now it is time to experience the scenery in
style.
We are going to be riding sidecars.
Check out the outfit.

For our last outing in Stellenbosch we joined
a sidecar tour with Cape Sidecar Adventures.

They do tours all over Cape Town, the Winelands,
and the Cape Peninsula.

We geared up in retro leather jackets, bandanas,
helmets and goggles, and then it was time
to hit the road!

I ditched Sam on this one to ride with Brody,
the coolest pup around!

He sat behind me on the sidecar, rested his
chin on my shoulder, and was unbelievably
cute the whole time.
It was puppy heaven.
Well, well how was it?
That was awesome.

It was really cool because I got to experience
riding on the back here but also on the sidecar
as well.
So and I got to ride with the dog.
Yeah, you did.
Which was awesome.
And the dog looked really well behaved.

It looked like it was having the best time
of its life.
I know.
It was cuddling.
It was cuddling.

I want to be a sidecar riding dog in my next
life.

Lastly for our final meal in Stellenbosch,
we all gathered together for lunch at a rather
unique restaurant: The Bus Stop!
Located at Stellenbosch Vineyards.

So as you probably know by now I'm all about
eating at restaurants with fun themes.

And today we're eating at a place called The
Bus Stop!
Hence, the bus.
So the bus is actually like the bar.

They have some beers on tap here and the theme
inside you're going to see it in a few minutes

it is all like bus signs and the chairs are
bus seats.
So it is pretty cool.
Let's go order some food.
So the food is here.

I ordered a strawberry milkshake and as you
can tell there is not much left.

Because it is almost gone and I haven't even
started lunch.
It was really good.

It is like an old-fashioned style milkshake
right?
Mmmm.
You've got to love that.
It is so so good.

I'm almost thinking of getting a second for
dessert.
You know what?

The last time we had a milkshake I think was
Shake Shack in the US.
So it has been a while.
It has been a little while.

Anyways, we've been having a lot of meat so
I went for a salad.

And this one is called the Birdie Bird and
it has chicken, avocado and crispy onion rings.
Oh la lah.

So yeah, this is kind of nice to have some
vegetables on my plate after eating lots of
steak.

Yeah, we've been eating a lot of amazing braai
and different deli cut meats and like a wonderful
spread of cheeses and wines.

But yeah, you're right it is nice to have
a bit of salad but with that being said I'm
getting pizza so there you go.
So Sam's pizza has arrived.
What is it called?
It is called Meh Pizza.
Take a look down here.

And it has lamb and look at this copious amounts
of goat cheese just sprinkled all over.
It looks amazing.
It looks it is wood fire oven cooked pizza.
Nice and thin.
So let's have the first slice.
Ah.
How is that?
Howzit?
Howzit?
How is the pizza?
Wow.
I love that.
Goat cheese.
Mmmm.
Mehhh.
Lamb is a really interesting ingredient.

I've never had that on a pizza before so it
is really good.
So Sam this is a bit of a mystery to me.
How do you have enough space for dessert?

I technically don't but I'm just a pure pig
so I'm going in.
A pure pig.
This is the other specialty of this place.
They make waffles.

And I'm having the one with rum and raisin
ice cream.

It has sliced banana and caramel sauce put
all over it.

So let's get a bite of that and see how it
is.
You better find some cutlery Becki?
And we have a friend to share with Becki.
There you go.
If I can find some cutlery.
Yeah, that is worth getting.
Alright, dig in.
And Becki has joined us.

So Becki this one is rum and raisin ice cream,
banana slices and caramel drizzled over top.
Oh my goodness.
Doesn't that just sound like amazing.
Just have a bite.
It is really good.
You're going to like this.
Mmmm.
Yeah, that hit the spot.

I'm full from lunch but I've got room for
this.
This is good.
There is always room for this.
Oh yeah, there is always room for this.

And just like that our week in Stellenbosch
was over!

I think it’s fair to say that we left a
few pounds heavier, but with a newfound appreciation

for South African wine and a taste of what
the winelands have to offer.

As always, we hope you enjoyed this travel
guide and that it gave you a few ideas of
things to do in Stellenbosch.

If you have any other suggestions of cool
things to see, eat, or experience, feel free

to share those with travellers in the comments
below.

In the meantime we wish you happy travels
and we’ll see you in Cape Town on our next
video!
